title: Dynamical Lensing Tomography of Black Hole Ringdown
authors: Zhen Zhong, Vitor Cardoso, Yifan Chen
abstract:
Strong gravitational lensing occurs when photons pass through the vicinity of
a black hole. We investigate this phenomenon in the context of a
gravitational-wave event, specifically when a black hole is settling into its
final state. The deflection angle of photons mimics the ringdown pattern of the
gravitational wave at intermediate times. At late times it has an inverse cubic
dependence on observation time. The deviation angle increases exponentially as
photons approach the photon ring orbit, reflecting its unstable nature. Our
findings are directly applicable to imaging scenarios involving stars against
the background of compact binaries, or circumbinary accretion disks,
particularly during the merger of two black holes.
